abstract: Struggling Japanese camera maker Olympus demotes its British chief executive, Michael C Woodford, after only six months on the job; swift firing is rare public rebuke to his aggressive management style, which clashed with Olympus's executive team.
snippet: Michael Woodford lost his job after six months because his management style did not mesh with the Japanese camera maker’s executive team.
lead_paragraph: Michael Woodford lost his job after six months because his management style did not mesh with the Japanese camera maker’s executive team.

headline.main: In a Culture Clash, Olympus Ousts Its British Chief
headline.print_headline: In a Culture Clash, Olympus Ousts Its British Chief
headline.seo: Japan’s Olympus Ousts Michael Woodford as President
